trans-unit.source: User > Setup module
trans-unit.target: User > Setup module

trans-unit.source: The Setup module allows the backend user to customize TYPO3 for his own login sessions. This includes the backend language and various other interface features.
trans-unit.target: The Setup module allows the backend user to customize TYPO3 for his own login sessions. This includes the backend language and various other interface features.

trans-unit.source: Notice [For Admins]: These settings can all be overridden or have their default values changed by "User TSconfig". To read more about this concept, see the link below!
trans-unit.target: Notice [For Admins]: These settings can all be overridden or have their default values changed by "User TSconfig". To read more about this concept, see the link below!

trans-unit.source: User TSconfig SETUP | http://typo3.org/documentation/document-library/doc_core_tsconfig/SETUP/
trans-unit.target: User TSconfig SETUP | http://typo3.org/documentation/document-library/doc_core_tsconfig/SETUP/

trans-unit.source: EXT:setup/cshimages/setup8.png, EXT:setup/cshimages/setup7.png
trans-unit.target: EXT:setup/cshimages/setup8.png, EXT:setup/cshimages/setup7.png

trans-unit.source: The Setup module is selected in the left menu. This is how the Setup module interface looks like - a list of options to configure.
trans-unit.target: The Setup module is selected in the left menu. This is how the Setup module interface looks like - a list of options to configure.

trans-unit.source: Backend Language selection
trans-unit.target: Backend Language selection

trans-unit.source: Select the backend language you prefer. Most parts of TYPO3s backend (for regular users) are translated into other languages.
trans-unit.target: Select the backend language you prefer. Most parts of TYPO3s backend (for regular users) are translated into other languages.

trans-unit.source: Warning [technical]: If TYPO3 is not configured to use a single character set (through $TYPO3_CONF_VARS[BE][forceCharset]) then all data entered in the backend is submitted in the character set of the selected backend language. This leads to inconsistent data storage if some users are using the backend in Russian and others in English which uses different character sets. The solution clearly is to set the configuration option mentioned above to a value like "utf-8". This must be done by the developers responsible for the whole system configuration.
trans-unit.target: Warning [technical]: If TYPO3 is not configured to use a single character set (through $TYPO3_CONF_VARS[BE][forceCharset]) then all data entered in the backend is submitted in the character set of the selected backend language. This leads to inconsistent data storage if some users are using the backend in Russian and others in English which uses different character sets. The solution clearly is to set the configuration option mentioned above to a value like "utf-8". This must be done by the developers responsible for the whole system configuration.

trans-unit.source: EXT:setup/cshimages/lang.png
trans-unit.target: EXT:setup/cshimages/lang.png

trans-unit.source: TYPO3 is translated into around 40 languages. English is the default language and all labels must be available in English first and foremost. This screenshot shows translations for Hebrew, Arabic, Russian and Chinese.
trans-unit.target: TYPO3 is translated into around 40 languages. English is the default language and all labels must be available in English first and foremost. This screenshot shows translations for Hebrew, Arabic, Russian and Chinese.

trans-unit.source: Condensed Mode
trans-unit.target: Condensed Mode

trans-unit.source: If set, the backend will not load the Web-submodules and File-submodules in a frameset but allow the page and folder trees to load the submodule in the main content frame. This allows for a better display on small screens.
trans-unit.target: If set, the backend will not load the Web-submodules and File-submodules in a frameset but allow the page and folder trees to load the submodule in the main content frame. This allows for a better display on small screens.

trans-unit.source: _MOD_user_setup:option_noMenuMode
trans-unit.target: _MOD_user_setup:option_noMenuMode

trans-unit.source: EXT:setup/cshimages/setup3.png, EXT:setup/cshimages/setup4.png
trans-unit.target: EXT:setup/cshimages/setup3.png, EXT:setup/cshimages/setup4.png

trans-unit.source: In this example Condensed Mode is enabled. The page tree is not shown in the normal navigation frame but rather in the full content frame to the right of the menu. When a page title is clicked in the page tree the module page (here the Web > List module) will be loaded in the same frame of the backend. In this way Condensed Mode saves horizontal screen space since the navigation frame is removed - but it takes an extra click if you need to go to another page.
trans-unit.target: In this example Condensed Mode is enabled. The page tree is not shown in the normal navigation frame but rather in the full content frame to the right of the menu. When a page title is clicked in the page tree the module page (here the Web > List module) will be loaded in the same frame of the backend. In this way Condensed Mode saves horizontal screen space since the navigation frame is removed - but it takes an extra click if you need to go to another page.

trans-unit.source: Navigation Mode
trans-unit.target: Navigation Mode

trans-unit.source: Setting alternative backend menu modes
trans-unit.target: Setting alternative backend menu modes

trans-unit.source: By default you navigate between backend modules with the menu in the left frame. By this option you can select alternative navigation modes: Selectorbox in top frame: If set, the backend will not load the left menu frame but rather put a selector-box menu in the topframe. This saves a lot of space on small screens. Icons in top frame This option shows all menu items in the top frame as a horizontal list of icons. This is for experienced users only who knows the order of modules and can recognize them based on their icon.
trans-unit.target: By default you navigate between backend modules with the menu in the left frame. By this option you can select alternative navigation modes: Selectorbox in top frame: If set, the backend will not load the left menu frame but rather put a selector-box menu in the topframe. This saves a lot of space on small screens. Icons in top frame This option shows all menu items in the top frame as a horizontal list of icons. This is for experienced users only who knows the order of modules and can recognize them based on their icon.

trans-unit.source: _MOD_user_setup:option_condensedMode
trans-unit.target: _MOD_user_setup:option_condensedMode

trans-unit.source: EXT:setup/cshimages/setup1.png, EXT:setup/cshimages/setup2.png
trans-unit.target: EXT:setup/cshimages/setup1.png, EXT:setup/cshimages/setup2.png

trans-unit.source: The "Selectorbox" menu. Selecting an item makes the backend jump to that module. The "Icons" menu. As you can see you will need to know the icons by heart. You can also position the mouse over the icon and the tool-tip text will reveal the module name.
trans-unit.target: The "Selectorbox" menu. Selecting an item makes the backend jump to that module. The "Icons" menu. As you can see you will need to know the icons by heart. You can also position the mouse over the icon and the tool-tip text will reveal the module name.

trans-unit.source: Start module
trans-unit.target: Start module

trans-unit.source: Let you select the module that is called when you login in the Backend The default module is "About Modules".
trans-unit.target: Let you select the module that is called when you login in the Backend The default module is "About Modules".

trans-unit.source: Show Thumbnails by default
trans-unit.target: Show Thumbnails by default

trans-unit.source: In modules like the "Web > List" and "File > Filelist" you can enable the display of thumbnails of files (images/fonts) and records (if images are attached) with a checkbox. Setting this option will enable the display by default.
trans-unit.target: In modules like the "Web > List" and "File > Filelist" you can enable the display of thumbnails of files (images/fonts) and records (if images are attached) with a checkbox. Setting this option will enable the display by default.

trans-unit.source: EXT:setup/cshimages/setup5.png
trans-unit.target: EXT:setup/cshimages/setup5.png

trans-unit.source: When thumbnails display is enabled, files attached to records will be shown in the "Web > List" module like this.
trans-unit.target: When thumbnails display is enabled, files attached to records will be shown in the "Web > List" module like this.

trans-unit.source: Show help text when applicable
trans-unit.target: Show help text when applicable

trans-unit.source: If set, some help texts will appear by default. Applies to the "Legend" text in the Web>Access module for instance.
trans-unit.target: If set, some help texts will appear by default. Applies to the "Legend" text in the Web>Access module for instance.

trans-unit.source: Maximum title length
trans-unit.target: Maximum title length

trans-unit.source: TYPO3 will often crop long titles of records etc. so only the first X characters are shown. Often the number of shown characters depends on this variable. For instance the length of page titles in the page tree is determined by this value.
trans-unit.target: TYPO3 will often crop long titles of records etc. so only the first X characters are shown. Often the number of shown characters depends on this variable. For instance the length of page titles in the page tree is determined by this value.

trans-unit.source: EXT:setup/cshimages/setup6.png
trans-unit.target: EXT:setup/cshimages/setup6.png

trans-unit.source: In this case the Maximum Title lenght is set to 10 - and the result is that titles in the page tree - as well as other places in the backend - will be cropped after 10 characters, then suffixed by "...". The default value is "30".
trans-unit.target: In this case the Maximum Title lenght is set to 10 - and the result is that titles in the page tree - as well as other places in the backend - will be cropped after 10 characters, then suffixed by "...". The default value is "30".

trans-unit.source: Recursive Copy
trans-unit.target: Recursive Copy

trans-unit.source: When you copy a page, subpages can also be copied along if you set this option. The number you set here defines the number of levels under a page to include in a copy operation.
trans-unit.target: When you copy a page, subpages can also be copied along if you set this option. The number you set here defines the number of levels under a page to include in a copy operation.

trans-unit.source: Recursive Delete
trans-unit.target: Recursive Delete

trans-unit.source: You cannot delete a page with subpages unless this flag is set. Be careful - setting this option means that TYPO3 will allow a whole tree of pages to be deleted in one go!
trans-unit.target: You cannot delete a page with subpages unless this flag is set. Be careful - setting this option means that TYPO3 will allow a whole tree of pages to be deleted in one go!

trans-unit.source: You should also consider the performance issues involved when deleting a large page tree. It might take a considerable amount of time to do that and if PHP times out before the operation is finished the results might be unpredictable.
trans-unit.target: You should also consider the performance issues involved when deleting a large page tree. It might take a considerable amount of time to do that and if PHP times out before the operation is finished the results might be unpredictable.

trans-unit.source: Wide document background
trans-unit.target: Wide document background

trans-unit.source: Setting this option will enlarge the default width of record editing forms in TYPO3 by around 50%
trans-unit.target: Setting this option will enlarge the default width of record editing forms in TYPO3 by around 50%

trans-unit.source: Enable Rich Text Editor
trans-unit.target: Enable Rich Text Editor

trans-unit.source: If set, the Rich Text Editor in TYPO3 will be enabled for you. Normally you wouldn't want to disable this option.
trans-unit.target: If set, the Rich Text Editor in TYPO3 will be enabled for you. Normally you wouldn't want to disable this option.

trans-unit.source: A Rich Text Editor (RTE) means that a text editing field has buttons for making selected text bold, italic etc. Whether a RTE is available also depends on factors like the browser you are using and which extensions are installed. Finally RTEs are applied to only a few record fields. The most wellknown example would be the Text field of a Content Element.
trans-unit.target: A Rich Text Editor (RTE) means that a text editing field has buttons for making selected text bold, italic etc. Whether a RTE is available also depends on factors like the browser you are using and which extensions are installed. Finally RTEs are applied to only a few record fields. The most wellknown example would be the Text field of a Content Element.

trans-unit.source: EXT:setup/cshimages/rte.png
trans-unit.target: EXT:setup/cshimages/rte.png

trans-unit.source: Enable File Uploads in editing forms
trans-unit.target: Enable File Uploads in editing forms

trans-unit.source: This option will enable an "Upload" box for each field in TYPO3 records where you can attach a file or image. Most likely you don't want to disable this since it is usually just a nice thing to have.
trans-unit.target: This option will enable an "Upload" box for each field in TYPO3 records where you can attach a file or image. Most likely you don't want to disable this since it is usually just a nice thing to have.

trans-unit.source: If you disable the Upload box there is still the TYPO3 Element Browser left for attaching files and images.
trans-unit.target: If you disable the Upload box there is still the TYPO3 Element Browser left for attaching files and images.

trans-unit.source: EXT:setup/cshimages/setup12.png
trans-unit.target: EXT:setup/cshimages/setup12.png

trans-unit.source: Enable Flash Uploader
trans-unit.target: Enable Flash Uploader

trans-unit.source: This option will enable a flash-based uploader that allows you to select multiple files at once when uploading files. If you enable this option, make sure that your browser has the latest Flash plugin (Flash 9 or higher) installed in order to make this feature work.
trans-unit.target: This option will enable a flash-based uploader that allows you to select multiple files at once when uploading files. If you enable this option, make sure that your browser has the latest Flash plugin (Flash 9 or higher) installed in order to make this feature work.

trans-unit.source: Context Sensitive Help mode
trans-unit.target: Context Sensitive Help mode

trans-unit.source: Make Textareas Resizable
trans-unit.target: Make Textareas Resizable

trans-unit.source: This option will make textareas resizable. You will see the resize mouse cursor if you move mouse to the outer border of textarea.
trans-unit.target: This option will make textareas resizable. You will see the resize mouse cursor if you move mouse to the outer border of textarea.

trans-unit.source: Maximal Height of Textarea
trans-unit.target: Maximal Height of Textarea

trans-unit.source: Define the maximal height of textarea (in Pixel).
trans-unit.target: Define the maximal height of textarea (in Pixel).

trans-unit.source: Make Textareas Flexible
trans-unit.target: Make Textareas Flexible

trans-unit.source: This option will make textareas flexible. The height will grow automatically while typing. Limit is the maximal height set (default 600).
trans-unit.target: This option will make textareas flexible. The height will grow automatically while typing. Limit is the maximal height set (default 600).

trans-unit.source: Defines the mode of Context Sensitive Help (CSH) in TYPO3. The default is that small help icons are shown everywhere a help item is available. You can click the icon and help will appear in a window for you.
trans-unit.target: Defines the mode of Context Sensitive Help (CSH) in TYPO3. The default is that small help icons are shown everywhere a help item is available. You can click the icon and help will appear in a window for you.

trans-unit.source:
Alternatively you can select that descriptions are shown inline. This is useful for people who are still learning how TYPO3 works and want to browse the backend with descriptions shown directly. Finally experienced users will want to totally disable the help icons if they seem to just bloat the backend interface.
Context Sensitive Help is also available as a full user manual in the Help>Manual module.
trans-unit.target:
Alternatively you can select that descriptions are shown inline. This is useful for people who are still learning how TYPO3 works and want to browse the backend with descriptions shown directly. Finally experienced users will want to totally disable the help icons if they seem to just bloat the backend interface.
Context Sensitive Help is also available as a full user manual in the Help>Manual module.

trans-unit.source: EXT:setup/cshimages/setup11.png, EXT:setup/cshimages/setup10.png
trans-unit.target: EXT:setup/cshimages/setup11.png, EXT:setup/cshimages/setup10.png

trans-unit.source: The default mode, "Display help icon only", will show the help icons with no additional text. When "Display full text message" is selected you will see a short description shown together with the help icon and framed into a box. Clicking the help icon always links to the full description of the element shown in a pop-up window.
trans-unit.target: The default mode, "Display help icon only", will show the help icons with no additional text. When "Display full text message" is selected you will see a short description shown together with the help icon and framed into a box. Clicking the help icon always links to the full description of the element shown in a pop-up window.

trans-unit.source: Disable Popup Context Menus
trans-unit.target: Disable Popup Context Menus

trans-unit.source: When an icon for a file or database record is shown inside the TYPO3 backend you can often click on the icon and a contextual menu will appear over the icon with options related to it. You can disable this behaviour by this option. However you probably don't want to do that.
trans-unit.target: When an icon for a file or database record is shown inside the TYPO3 backend you can often click on the icon and a contextual menu will appear over the icon with options related to it. You can disable this behaviour by this option. However you probably don't want to do that.

trans-unit.source: EXT:setup/cshimages/setup9.png
trans-unit.target: EXT:setup/cshimages/setup9.png

trans-unit.source: This is the context menu (or "Clickmenu") of a page in the page tree. Notice that it is activated by a regular "left-click" opposite to the normal "right-click" activation known from most Operating Systems.
trans-unit.target: This is the context menu (or "Clickmenu") of a page in the page tree. Notice that it is activated by a regular "left-click" opposite to the normal "right-click" activation known from most Operating Systems.

trans-unit.source: Your real name
trans-unit.target: Your real name

trans-unit.source: Enter your real name here.
trans-unit.target: Enter your real name here.

trans-unit.source: Your email address
trans-unit.target: Your email address

trans-unit.source: Make sure this is a valid email address for you. This is the contact address that the backend administrator will use if he needs to contact you. Also, the TYPO3 system might need to send you messages at various times and this will be the recipient address.
trans-unit.target: Make sure this is a valid email address for you. This is the contact address that the backend administrator will use if he needs to contact you. Also, the TYPO3 system might need to send you messages at various times and this will be the recipient address.

trans-unit.source: Notify by login
trans-unit.target: Notify by login

trans-unit.source: If you set this option you will receive an email from TYPO3 each time you (or "someone") logs in using your username. You might like to receive such a "warning" as a security measure so you will know if someone else picks up your password and uses your account.
trans-unit.target: If you set this option you will receive an email from TYPO3 each time you (or "someone") logs in using your username. You might like to receive such a "warning" as a security measure so you will know if someone else picks up your password and uses your account.

trans-unit.source: Change password
trans-unit.target: Change password

trans-unit.source: Enter a new password for your backend account:
trans-unit.target: Enter a new password for your backend account:

trans-unit.source: The passwords are encrypted to an MD5 hash when you leave the field so no plain text password is sent over the wire.
trans-unit.target: The passwords are encrypted to an MD5 hash when you leave the field so no plain text password is sent over the wire.

trans-unit.source: Change password, confirm
trans-unit.target: Change password, confirm

trans-unit.source: Confirm the new password by entering it again, exactly like above. If the two new passwords do not match, the password will not be changed.
trans-unit.target: Confirm the new password by entering it again, exactly like above. If the two new passwords do not match, the password will not be changed.

trans-unit.source: Reset all Values to default
trans-unit.target: Reset all Values to default

trans-unit.source: If you select this option all settings in this module will be reset to the default settings of the system.
trans-unit.target: If you select this option all settings in this module will be reset to the default settings of the system.

trans-unit.source: This does not apply to user name, email and password settings of course.
trans-unit.target: This does not apply to user name, email and password settings of course.

trans-unit.source: Simulate backend user
trans-unit.target: Simulate backend user

trans-unit.source: This option allows "admin"-users to change settings for another backend user in the system.
trans-unit.target: This option allows "admin"-users to change settings for another backend user in the system.

trans-unit.source: Admin control for re-enabling Install Tool access
trans-unit.target: Admin control for re-enabling Install Tool access

trans-unit.source: By clicking this button, a file typo3conf/ENABLE_INSTALL_TOOL is created (or removed if it already exists). It unlocks the access to the Install Tool (password is still needed!) and will be removed automatically after 1 hour.
trans-unit.target: By clicking this button, a file typo3conf/ENABLE_INSTALL_TOOL is created (or removed if it already exists). It unlocks the access to the Install Tool (password is still needed!) and will be removed automatically after 1 hour.
